title: OSPF Version 2
abstract:
This memo documents version 2 of the OSPF protocol. OSPF is a
link-state routing protocol.  It is designed to be run internal to
a single Autonomous System.  Each OSPF router maintains an identical
database describing the Autonomous System's topology.  From this
database, a routing table is calculated by constructing a
shortest-path tree.

OSPF recalculates routes quickly in the face of topological changes,
utilizing a minimum of routing protocol traffic.  OSPF provides
support for equal-cost multipath.  An area routing capability is
provided, enabling an additional level of routing protection and a
reduction in routing protocol traffic.  In addition, all OSPF
routing protocol exchanges are authenticated.  [STANDARDS-TRACK]
